page.title: 07 TRANSPORT (2)
page.content: In terms of medical care, most people go to the Kimbolton Doctors' Surgery, and to Huntingdon and St.Neots for dental treatment. To help those without transport of their own, a well-used mobile library visits us fortnightly and one of our Parish Councillors volunteers to collect medicines, weekly, from Kimbolton. Most of us have come to depend on car transport for shopping. Infrequent bus services are available, though, to Bedford, St.Neots and Peterborough. According to our survey 17% do bulk shopping in Cambridge or Bedford; 30% in Huntingdon, and 53% in St.Neots. Although most people thought that long distances and poor public transport make life more difficult, they agreed that ready access to the A1 makes car transport easier.
